definitions.definition: Matter in a state intermediate between liquid and plasma that can be contained only if it is fully surrounded by a solid (or in a bubble of liquid) (or held together by gravitational pull); it can condense into a liquid, or can (rarely) become a solid directly.
definitions.example: A lot of gas had escaped from the cylinder.

definitions.definition: A chemical element or compound in such a state.
definitions.example: The atmosphere is made up of a number of different gases.

definitions.definition: A flammable gaseous hydrocarbon or hydrocarbon mixture (typically predominantly methane) used as a fuel, e.g. for cooking, heating, electricity generation or as a fuel in internal combustion engines in vehicles.
definitions.example: Gas-fired power stations have largely replaced coal-burning ones.

definitions.definition: A hob on a gas cooker.
definitions.example: She turned the gas on, put the potatoes on, then lit the oven.

definitions.definition: Methane or other waste gases trapped in one's belly as a result of the digestive process.
definitions.example: My tummy hurts so bad, I have gas.

definitions.definition: A humorous or entertaining event or person.
Frothy talk; chatter.
A fastball.
definitions.example: The closer threw him nothing but gas.

definitions.definition: Arterial or venous blood gas.
Marijuana, typically of high quality.
To kill with poisonous gas.
To talk in a boastful or vapid way; chatter.
To impose upon by talking boastfully.
To emit gas.
To impregnate with gas.
definitions.example: to gas lime with chlorine in the manufacture of bleaching powder

definitions.definition: To singe, as in a gas flame, so as to remove loose fibers.
Gasoline; a derivative of petroleum used as fuel.
Gas pedal.
To give a vehicle more fuel in order to accelerate it.
definitions.example: The cops are coming. Gas it!

definitions.definition: To fill (a vehicle's fuel tank) with fuel.
Comical, zany; fun, amusing
definitions.example: It was gas when the bird flew into the classroom.
